definition: to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: Perhaps this was his modus operandi.
sentences.chinese: 或許這就是他獨樹一格的作法。

sentences.english: Readers love the unconventionality of the author's novels.
sentences.chinese: 讀者們喜愛這位作家獨樹一格的小說風格。

definition: to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
